QuestDef.Description:
"I have tried to form a village here," the village elder says. "But we are little more than fatted calves for the bandits that consume our wheat and slaughter our lambs. I have failed."
"If you can stop these bandits, what remains of my soldiers will join you."
QuestDef.SuccessText: "Thank you." the village elder says, "We will join you if you would have us."

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
It isn't difficult to track down the bandits and they don't stop you from walking into their camp and approaching the ramshackle throne of their leader.
"I've talked to the village elder and I've agreed to clear you from these lands." you say. "You can either leave or I will string you up for your crimes."
The bandit captain laughs. "Ah, but I am sure he forgot to mention that I am his son, and that he is the reason that his people starve."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You're as mad as a hatter. Die! (attack)
I will leave, for now.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "Slither away with your yellow tail." the bandit captain calls as you walk away.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Why should I believe you?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"You can slaughter us, but what will you gain? My father, last year, insisted we not rotate our crops, for fear of roaming monsters. And then, come winter, two dozen families starved when the wheat yields were far too low."
"I was going to seize power without violence. But he blamed the failure on me, and banished me. The men sided with me, so we left and have subsisted as bandits. But we have never hurt our own people - it is my father, the elder's fault, that they suffer."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I'll make you dead as a doornail! (attack)
Then you should serve under me. I will take better care of your people than your father, or you can.
I am going to return to your father, and confront him.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "Why? How will you lead us to a better life?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You're right. People as sad as you are useless to my progress! (attack)
I cannot promise perfection. But I will make the hard choices and sacrifices necessary.
You listen to me, you live. You don't, you die. Doesn't that make sense?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "All right. But on one condition only - that you allow me to be present when I confront my father."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No one gives me conditions. Die! (attack)
No conditions. I demand absolute loyalty.
I agree. Let us go visit your father once more.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "What? I was a fool to consider cooperation. Men, attack!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: That is your final mistake. (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the village and confront the elder

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You return to the village, and the elder's eyes are full of hope.
"Are we safe from those bandits?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You mean, your own son?
(Lie) They're dead. Give me the reward.
You're a liar. No one lies to me! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The Elder is dead, and his only fighting troops with him. The people are hungry and desperate. What shall be done with them?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Allow them to join your faction willingly.
Force them to serve under you.
I want nothing further to do with these people. May they rot in obscurity. (abandon quest)
(kill them all, and burn the village)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "Whatever he told you is a lie. He betrayed me! He should have followed his father, without question!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I want the truth - or I will kill you.
I know you're holding back. Tell me the truth, before all your people starve.
I don't have time for this nonsense. Give me your archers, or you die.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "You win. Please just leave us in peace."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: That's it, you die! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "He is a traitor. What else is there to say?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: If you will not talk, then I want you to resign and pledge your people to my nation.
He never attacked you, did he? You banished him to hide from your mistakes.
That's it, you die! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "Yes. I- I am a proud man. But it is probably too late, for my rule. Many deaths are my fault."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You are weak enough to admit it? Then I shall kill you like a dog! (attack)
Thank you for speaking the truth. Let your tribe join my nation.
I want nothing further to do with you or your people. Rot in obscurity. (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "I resign. Take them as your own."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall take them as slaves.
They are welcome if they choose to follow me.
You are so pathetic, I must kill you out of principle! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the village and confront the elder

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You return to the village, and the elder's eyes are full of terror. Word has already reached him that the bandit leader joined you.
"You were supposed to kill them!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You mean, your own son?
You're a liar. No one lies to me! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The Elder is dead, and his only fighting troops with him. The people are hungry and desperate. What shall be done with them?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Allow them to join your faction willingly.
Force them to serve under you.
I want nothing further to do with these people. May they rot in obscurity. (abandon quest)
(kill them all, and burn the village)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "He betrayed me! He should have followed his father, without question!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I want the truth - or I will kill you.
I know you're holding back. Tell me the truth, before all your people starve.
I don't have time for this nonsense. Give me your archers, or you die.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: "You win. Please just leave us in peace."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: That's it, you die! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "I failed my people. It was a dark moment. I needed my son to support me - but he wanted to seize power! How could he do that?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I want you to resign and pledge your people to my nation.
He never attacked you, did he? You banished him to hide from your mistakes.
That's it, you die! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "Many deaths are my fault. Perhaps it is best that I abdicate."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You are weak enough to admit it? Then I shall kill you like a dog! (attack)
Thank you for speaking the truth. Let your tribe join my nation.
I want nothing further to do with you or your people. Rot in obscurity. (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "I resign. Take them as your own."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall take them as slaves.
They are welcome if they choose to follow me.
You are so pathetic, I must kill you out of principle! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Return to the village and confront the elder

QuestDef.Description:
This is a graveyard - empty of any life. But spirits gather here, drawn by the flux between life and death. Your spell has drawn you and your bonded mount together by this crossroads of spirits. One of them will guide you to your bound animal brother. The rest, however, may have other intentions.
If you persist, you might awaken and confront spirits of terrible power. Should you continue?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You step forward, and a banshee form coalesces before you. You reach for your weapon, but it does not attack.
"I was like you, once. I used the arcane to empower my thirst for ordering the world. But there can be no lasting justice, as there can be no enduring power, or persisting life."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You may be correct, spirit, but I must strive on nontheless.
Impede me no further, and silence your words of despair!
G-g-ghosts are s-s-scary! (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"Very well. We shall see what fate you weave, before you join us in the beyond."
The banshee fades, but it speaks again:
"Some of the spirits here are connected to living creatures, not the dead - creatures that might be bound to you. But what kind of spirit are you, channeler, that you would bind yourself to another?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I am a wild wanderer. I hunt to survive, and relish the thrill.
I am furious, and untamed. But when my will is focused, I am mighty.
I am temperant. I strive on despite weariness and difficulty, and thus I can complete journeys some would call impossible.
(more choices)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "What kind of spirit are you?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I am meticulous. I plan, and watch before acting with terrible and decisive results.
I am primeval, and strong. I patiently await for when my foes are neediest and thus distracted, and then strike at their soft throats.
I am a detached spirit that watches the world from afar. But when evil concentrates, I must act.
(previous choices)

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

Objective.Text: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
A beautiful mare approaches you, and snorts. For some time, you stare at one another, an understanding growing between you. It is as if a psychic connection is forming between you.
You mount the horse, and it resists at first, testing you. But soon you are comfortable upon it, and it accepts you as its rider.
Your have found your bound animal brother.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: My quest is complete.

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

Objective.Text: Find the spirit that draws you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive, seeing only salted clay baked by an unforgiving sun.
And then it appears, charging towards you. It is a great War Boar, singular in purpose: if you two are to be bound, then you must defeat it - alone!

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall prove who is master.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The mighty boar falls, exhausted and incapacitated. You stand over it, and stare into its eyes.
It understands now, that you are worthy of being master. You take your place upon its back, and the bond between you is complete.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I ride onward!

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

Objective.Text: Find the spirit that draws you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive, hearing only silence among the trees. Too much silence - there is no breeze, no sound of birds. You feel that you are being stalked by a skilled hunter.
And then it appears, lunging forward with teeth. It is a Warg, singular in purpose: if you two are to be bound, then you must defeat it - alone!

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall prove who is master.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The warg falls, exhausted and incapacitated. You stand over it, and stare into its eyes.
It understands now, that you are worthy of being master. You take your place upon its back, and the bond between you is complete.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I ride onward!

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

Objective.Text: Find the spirit that draws you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive at an old farmhouse, wrapped in old webs. How many living things have jad their vitality sucked from them, while trapped by those webs?
There is no time for reflection - the monstrosity skitters out from the house with deadly, inhuman grace. It senses your presence, and will not tolerate submission to a prey-thing. It is a giant black widow, singular in purpose: if you two are to be bound, then you must defeat it - alone!

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall prove who is master.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The great spider falls, exhausted and incapacitated. You stand over it, and stare into its many eyes.
It understands now, that you are worthy of being master. You take your place upon its back, and the bond between you is complete.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I ride onward!

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

Objective.Text: Find the spirit that draws you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive, hearing the cacophony of insects that fills the swamps. This is a place where old, reptilian masters rule the food chain.
It lunges from the murk below without warning - but you felt its malice just in time to leap back. Staring at you with reptilian hunger is a mire skath, singular in purpose: if you two are to be bound, then you must defeat it - alone!

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall prove who is master.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The skath falls, exhausted and incapacitated. You stand over it, and stare into its eyes.
It understands now, that you are worthy of being master. You take your place upon its back, and the bond between you is complete.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I ride onward!

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

Objective.Text: Find the spirit that draws you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive at the swamp. A shape of dancing light comes forth from behind a wall of vines.
"I have watched the world from afar for so long. Let me bind to you, and we shall protect the small and weak things of the world."
The shape transforms, becoming white as a cloud on a clear day, its body held up by four strong agile legs.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I ride onward!

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: Find the spirit that draws you to binding.

Objective.Text: Find the spirit that draws you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive at the cave. Layers of caked ash flow away from the dark cave. Within, you can feel that an ancient beast waits within. It senses your presence as much as you can sense its - and it feels nothing but contempt for you. That you would think yourself worthy to master it is a deep insult!
And then it appears, proudly marching forward, its wings blotting out the daylight. It is an adolescent ashwake dragon, a mighty creature few have ever witnessed.
If you two are to be bound, then you must defeat it - alone!

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall prove who is master.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The dragon falls, exhausted and incapacitated. You stand over it, and stare into its eyes.
It understands now, that you are worthy of being master. Its pride will forever be scarred, but its loyalty to you is won. You take your place upon its back, and the bond between you is complete.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I ride onward!

QuestDef.Description: There is a tribe of people here, and you don't need to hear their story to know it is a sad one. Their small camp reeks of death. Most lie on the ground, with horrible boils on their arms and faces.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: I have difficulty enough without a pox on me and my soldiers.
QuestDef.SuccessText: You pick up the shield, and can feel its mighty magic. The spirit Ebleramis has become a shield of no equal, and the power within it gives you hope.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The elder approaches, and welcomes you - but he is probably in the worst shape of any, barely able to stand.
"There is a Dark Wizard, who lives not far. I believe he cast a powerful hex upon us. It is the only plausible explanation."
The elder slips to his knees, struggling to breathe.
"His fortress is near here. If you talk with him, he may lift the hex."
The elder points to a pile of crates near his tent.
"We have an item of value. I can offer that as reward."
You could take whatever is in that crate, and they could do nothing to stop you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I will seek out the wizard.
(attack and kill them all)
The strong take from the weak, fool. (take his item)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
There is a chill in the air as you approach the Dark Wizard's spire. You call for the wizard, and he does indeed appear. His mere presence exudes power.
"I am deep in research channeler. My magic could kill you easily. So tell me - why do you interrupt me?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I want you to lift the disease.
Die! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"One of these people already came to me, begging the spell be lifted. But I cast no such spell. They seek some reason for their affliction. Perhaps they angered another channeler, who cursed them. Or Elemental's magic coalesced at random, and expressed itself as a disease. These possibilities are the price for living in a world of magic. Who can say for sure? Not I."
You try to decide if the wizard is lying to you or not. But he is suddenly angry.
"Why would I care about those foolish people? My magic has much more important purposes. Leave me, you have wasted enough of my time!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: We return to the refugee camp.
You die. (attack)
Forget the people. Join me, and own the world alongside me.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The wizard laughs, deeply.
"Then your essence shall help fuel my ambitions, fool."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: (Fight)

Objective.Text: Expend 50 Mana to heal those still alive.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
At the camp, the disease is clearly still with them.
The elder has died. Many have joined him. Those few still alive - maybe a dozen? - are all infected, and getting worse. Without a cure, these people are all doomed.
The chest with their "asset" is still there, completely unguarded.
You think you can cast a spell to cure them. But it might not work.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I cannot be dragged down with them. (take their valuable item)
Cast a spell to try purging the disease. (-50 mana)
I will return.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You send out powerful magic. Your spell of curing begins to work - but then a more powerful spell reacts. It is already within them, and against your influence it easily sustains the disease.
They realize your spell has not worked. One of the people thanks you nontheless. "Please, My Lord. You have done more for us than any. We are doomed, and we have resigned to that. Please take your reward, and go on to preserve life elsewhere. Your efforts shall not be forgotten."
Did the wizard lie? Was the spell his, or did some other magical source afflict these people?
An idea comes to your mind - if you were to expend some of your essence, you might purge the pox spell, allowing your curing spell to have its effect. But this would leave you irreversibly weakened. If this somehow fails to defeat the pox spell, you shall still be permamnently diminished.
Your responsibility is to your people first - these refugees are too few to be of much consequence now, dead or alive. If they are cured, you may grow your fame. But is that worth the permanent price you shall pay?
It is your decision as Sovereign.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I can do nothing more for these people, alas. (accept their reward, leave)
I shall expend some of my essence. I will not abandon these souls.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You cut a part of your own essence away from you. It is a terrifying and painful feeling, but your will holds true. Something detaches from you, and you feel weak and drained. But this part of you moves out in a shower of brilliant light, and touches each of the survivors. They perk up, feeling refreshed.
You are pained with the feeling that part of you is missing. But laughter is heard in the camp for the first time in months.
The sickness returns with a vengeance later that evening. Each of them has a part of you in them, so you stay. The pox takes them, one by one. The last to die, a young girl, thanks you for your dedication to her people.
You bury their bodies in a field of wildflowers.
You burn with fury and sadness. You suspect the source of this disease shall never be discovered, and this crime will never be avenged. Your sacrifice did nothing but make their inevitable deaths more painful to you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I have erred greatly. I must somehow return to the affairs of my kingdom.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"I do not believe you have erred, sovereign."
Before you is a wisp.
"I sensed the sadness and pain here. I hoped to help these people in their suffering. Alas, I arrived here too late. But I also sensed some comfort in their end. A part of you comforted them, within."
Its presence gives you unease. "I do not need the story told to me, wisp."
"I am not hear to tell your tale. Rather, I recognize your actions. What you have done is a sacrifice few could make. I am known as Ebleramis - I search for those like you, who have the will to help the weak and suffering. Please take my power, and use it to fight and sacrifice again. I shall take the form of a shield..."
The wisp begins to change. Indeed, it seems to become metal.
"We cannot save those lives now - they are gone. But when evil next rears its head, together we shall shield the weak, and those who defend them."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I shall honor their memories by striving onward.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "Join you? Please. What could you possibly offer me?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You shall grow powerful under my command.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The villagers scream as you and your men slaughter them. Even sick, their instincts for pain and fear make their deaths intense and affecting.
A presence is rising from their corpses. Death magic is coalescing into physical form.
"I am Uzzerraddax. I kill without regard, without design. Yet you have given a crescendo to my plague here, sweetened it with undue aggression. I want you to serve me further..."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Serve you? I serve no one.
You will serve me!
How would I benefit?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"I am death unweighted and beautiful. If you seek power, bow to me and you shall have it. Defy me, and you shall be dissassembled just as you slaughtered these weak fools."
This demon is dreadfully powerful - it could be quite a fight.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Never. Die, Demon! (attack)
Tell me what you want.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "I will bind a part of myself to you. We shall be as brothers, murder and atrocity against this world. You shall yield some of your essence to me, and in exchange you shall have my power. You shall be weakened, of course. But my assistance shall make you greater than you ever were before."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No deal. (attack)
I agree. We shall be bound to one another.
Why would I allow myself to be bound to a mere demon?
No deal. Let's get out of here. (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The ground shakes from its laughter.
"I am no mere demon. I have existed since before this world formed. I am quite eternal. If you cannot sense that, then perhaps I should not waste time with you."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No deal. (attack)
Very well. Let us be bound together by spirit.
I shall make no commitment. We withdraw. (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The demon falls motionless. but you have an uneasy feeling.
"You shall not forget this mistake, channeler," a disembodied voice booms out. "I am far more eternal than one simple form. Know that you carry my mark, now. I shall follow you, and torment you as long as your consciousness persists."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: The torment shall be yours.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"Good. Good!"
The demon fades away, and then you scream out in pain. It feels as if your veins are pumping liquid razors. Your vision blurs, and everything goes black.
You awaken later, to your troops standing around you. A heavy hangover-feeling is upon you. But in your hand is a sword, its blade pure shadow. You hear distant laughter - and then the voice of Uzzerraddax in your head.
"We are one, now. I am in the sword, and the sword is me. Let us tear down all that dares grow, may you torture all that is beautiful."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I hope this proves a wise bargain.
Let's go do more killing.

QuestDef.Description: Sitting for food and drink, you meet a friendly nobleman. Hearing your stories of defeating the horrors of this new world, he is impressed. He requests that you escort his daughter back to his estate. He promises a valuable sword as a reward.
QuestDef.ShortTextDeny: I will waste no time with petty errands.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
She is quite fair, but shy. And there is more hiding behind her silence - she seems quite deliberate in not speaking whenever possible, but seems quite aware of everything you do. You aren't sure if it is her fancying you, or feeling deep distrust in your character.
Your men are rested, and it is time to go.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Maybe I'll learn more about her on the way. We move.
Doesn't matter. I want the nobleman's valuable reward, let's go.
No, something isn't right here. Find another escort for your mute, fey daughter. (abandon quest).
I feel like I've done this quest before, somehow...is there an igyns shortbow in my future?

QuestObjectiveDef.Description: The noble points to the location of his estate on your map, promising that his steward will give you your reward when his daughter arrives safely.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: You failed to protect the noble's daughter and she died a most gruesome death. Her father will not be pleased...

Objective.Text: Don't allow the noblewoman to arrive unescorted.

QuestConditionDef.CompletionText: The noblewoman's father is furious that you allowed her to make the journey home without an escort and refuses to give any reward.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The entire journey, you have not been able to shake a strange feeling - another presence following you, as you escort the young, still silent noblewoman.
You sight the grounds of the estate, not far ahead. She seems surprised that you have arrived. She looks at you with desperation:
"Please do not return me. My father is an evil man. I have only learned this recently, but - if you return me, I will come to harm. And there will be evil done to your nation, some day, as well!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: How is he so evil?
Silence! I didn't march all this way to give up my reward. Keep walking.
No, relax, I've done this quest before. We go to the estate, you're safe, and I choose between a bow and some gold.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You arrive to find bandits camped outside of the estate. Their leader approaches, and offers you a deal.
"We want the girl. Give her to us and we will pay you 200 gold to release her to our custody."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: That's a generous offer.
No. Stand aside!
You bandits are soft. And I do not tolerate weakness.
Tell me why you want her - 200 gold is a lot.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: What is your choice? Either you negotiate - or we take her from you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: 200 gold, you said? It's a deal! (+200 Gildar, but abandon the quest)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: The noblewoman bursts into tears as you hand her over to the bandits.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I will not betray my task. (attack)
You are all too incapable to spare! (Kill the daughter, attack bandits)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
After the battle, the family steward emerges and quickly looks the young noblewoman over. He sends the young woman inside before turning to offer you reward.
"I can pay you 100 Gildar or a sword enchanted to punish twisted creatures and elementals. Which would you prefer?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: The Gildar. (+100 Gildar)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You are thanked once more with grace, then sent off, reward in hand.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I could use the sword.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You are thanked once more with grace, then sent off, reward in hand.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The bandits are shocked to see you cut the girl's throat, and turn your murderous eyes on them.
"What- how could you kill her?" The leader of the bandits asks. Even to him, that was heartless.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: She was weak. As are you - now see the dividends paid to the helpless in this world! (attack)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The young noble's daughter is dead. There is no quest to complete, now.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: But the weak have been punished. This is deeply satisfying.
I could have gotten the reward before I murdered her. I will strive to control myself better, in the future.
...What have I done?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: Simple! The nobleman is said to be quite powerful. And rich. The girl's life is most valuable to him - thus I want to have her life in my hands, when he names the price for her freedom.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You are a sensible businessman.
You filthy kidnapper.
You ransoming mite!
I recommend slicing off fingers and ears. Higher price in the end.
If you assaulted his estate and took what you wanted from him, I'd respect you.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
Please listen! I am not certain how, but that man who hired you - he is not my father. Not anymore. A year ago, my father changed. He began to do horrible experiments at night. Strange travelers came to the house, in the middle of the night, and sometimes there would be screams. And in the gardens, during the day, there were monstrous footprints.
Whatever he was doing, evil was being born of it. You only met us at the Inn because I had run away, and he found and caught me. I believe he intends to do experiments on me, next.
Please - he has become some kind of evil magician! He only hired you because he can no longer stand to walk in the sunlight. Returning me will only help to advance his evil!

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I will wait for him to return, tonight.
Fascinating story. But I have a reward to collect, so get to walking dear.
I could use a Necromancer ally...I mean, ahem, I will wait to see him, tonight.
He sounds horrible, my dear. I am MUCH WORSE! (kill her).

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You wait at a distance from the estate, and watch the road approaching it. Night comes, and then a coach approaches the estate.
"That is my father's coach! He has returned!" She runs and hides behind a bush.
What do you do?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I am done with this quest. I signed up for an ignys shortbow, not this madness.
I will knock on the front door.
I will sneak in the backdoor.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You open the front door, and the steward says his master has been waiting for you to come to the door.
You enter the house, and a man in a robe greets you - the nobleman you met at the inn, but now seeming quite different. Quite a bit more powerful, in fact.
"I am strongest at night, channeler. But you have brought my daughter, as asked - have you not? Allow me to reward you, per our agreement. And then you can be on your way."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You are a thing of evil - I cannot allow you to live!
What magical experiments do you do at night?
How powerful are you, exactly?
She's outside, behind a bush. I'll take the reward now!

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The steward aproaches you.
"I can pay you 100 Gildar or a sword enchanted to punish twisted creatures and elementals. Which would you prefer?"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: The Gildar. (+100 Gildar)
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You are sent promptly on your way, reward in hand. The girl is never seen again.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I could use the sword.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You are sent promptly on your way, reward in hand. The girl is never seen again.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "I have studied death magic long, and intensely. I am your superior in the channeling arts." He laughs. "Are you afraid? You should be."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Afraid? Let me show you the MEANING of fear! (attack)
I do not let fear guide my choices. I am taking the girl, and leaving. Good night.
Death magic? Then we are enemies - defend yourself! (attack)
Sounds wonderful. Want to help me conquer the world?
Run away! (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "You shall go nowhere! The girl is MINE!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Do not impede my exit.
Run away! (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
You sneak into the back door of the mansion, moving quietly. But then a torch is lit, and a man in robes stands before you.
"I am too a powerful a magician for your petty burglary, channeler! To see one such as you sneaking in my parlor? Shameful."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I wish to speak with you.
You die! (attack)
Run away! (abandon quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"Then we shall battle, channeler!"
The family steward transforms, into a ritualist assistant.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: (attack them)
No. There is no benefit to us fighting.
Er, actually - run like the cowards we are! (abandon quest)

Objective.Text: Kill the Nobleman and his steward.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "Cooperation? I did not think you would be interested in that..." He laughs. "Divert 5 mana to me, every turn - even after my death, as you will perceive it - do this, and I shall join you. And I keep the girl, of course."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: That offer is an insult! (attack)
Forget it. I am taking the girl, and leaving. Good night.
You have a deal.
QuestChoiceDef.PopupMessage: You begin to pay the mana cost, and the nobleman agrees to follow you.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Actually, I am sleepy. Enjoy turning your daughter into a demon, or what have you. Night! (abandons quest)

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
The nobleman, dark wizard, or whatever it was he had become, falls dead.
There had been many magical artifacts, including a silver broadsword. But his death seems to have sucked away the enchantment from everyting in the house, leaving his treasures cracked and uselesss.
As the sun rises, the daughter finds you once more, and asks to allow her to follow you on your further adventures.
"I am no champion, but perhaps I could learn under your lead. My father had some channeling ability, and I believe I inherited a small sliver of that talent - I merely need a master to help me develop my meager talents."
Will you take her with you?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No, I go on alone. Enjoy your father's property. Don't dabble in his magic, though, or I'll find you.
Did you think I did this to save you? Only by purging all weakness can Elemental have peace! (kill her)
You shall come with me.
I just wanted my ignys bow.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: The young noble's daughter is dead. All who have opposed you, have died.

QuestChoiceDef.Description: But the weak have been punished. This is deeply satisfying.
...What have I done?

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText: "Are you mad, channeler? If you do not defend yourself, then I shall kill you and take your essence!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You're right. En guarde!
No. We shall talk, and then I shall leave with the girl.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
"Never! The girl is my property. Do you think you can use your pathetic powers to influence my mind? It shall have no effect!"
"I need no mind control," you say. "If you kill me, I shall not die, but escape to my territory - and we shall battle again. It might be the ruin of my kingdom, but I shall eventually raise an army that defeats you."
"No!" he interjects. "I will raise an army of my own!"

QuestChoiceDef.Description: Good point. Better you die now!
No. We both have higher projects to attend to. Release the girl to me and I shall leave you in peace.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
He does not respond at first - he realizes the wisdom in your position.
"The girl must stay. I need her for - the future."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I'll release her - but I want a more powerful magical item in return for peace between us.
She was once loved by you - if she dies, you shall regret it, somewhere inside, even if not right away.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
He laughs. "You are a wise negotiator, indeed!"
He nods to his assistant, who retrieves something valuable from the basement.
"This is precious, indeed, channeler. A worthy tribute to our non-violent future, together."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: You were most reasonable. Have a pleasant evening.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
He grunts.
"Take her. Begone, before I change my mind."

QuestChoiceDef.Description: I honor your grace in releasing her. And we shall have peace - so long as no evil grows from your sphere, into mine.

QuestObjectiveDef.ChoiceText:
As the sun rises, the daughter finds you once more, and asks to allow her to follow you on your further adventures.
"I am no champion, but perhaps I could learn under your lead. My father had some channeling ability, and I believe I inherited a small sliver of that talent - I merely need a master to help me develop my meager talents."
Will you take her with you?

QuestChoiceDef.Description: No, I go on alone.
You shall come with me.
